page.title: 12Hadlow College
page.content: In Hadlow there is a college.There are two parts to the college.One part has animals and the other has crops and plants.Every summer about 150 students come to learn about agriculture and horticulture. The College covers 600 acres(420 acres is for agriculture and 150 acres for horticulture). Every year they go to the Kent Show and show people their cows and sheep. They have a competition to see who has the best animals. The College runs specialist courses in fruit growing,glasshouse crop production,nursery practice and arable farming.Hadlow is the only college in the country where specialist fruit and hop growing courses are run and is the South East Regional Centre for Horticulture.
